_transformers package¶

Submodules¶

_transformers.agentstringflattener module¶

class _transformers.agentstringflattener.AgentStringFlattener(agg_col='SM_USERNAME', agent_string_col='SM_AGENTNAME', agent_size_limit=5, window_length=900, window_step=900)[source]¶

Bases: _transformers.sparknativetransformer.SparkNativeTransformer, pyspark.ml.param.shared.HasOutputCol

A transformer that flattens and cleans a target column (SM_AGENTNAME) of a spark dataframe.

Input: A Spark dataframe containing SM_AGENTNAME, SM_TIMESTAMP, and SM_CLIENTIP (from raw_logs), and the following column.

Column_Name Datatype Description
self.getOr Default(” agg_col”) string Pivot Column containing the CommonNames for each user. It is an alpha-numeric string and it may contain NULL values.

Please refer README.md for further description of raw_logs.

Output: A Spark Dataframe with the following features calculated on rows aggregated by time window and agg_col, where the window is calculated using:

  • length: how many seconds the window is
  • step: the length of time between the start of successive time window
Column_Name Datatype Description
SM_AGENTNAME
array

<string>

 Contains a list of flattened and/or cleaned agentnames
agent_size_limit = Param(parent='undefined', name='agent_size_limit', doc='Number of agent strings processed.Given as the number of strings.')¶
agent_string_col = Param(parent='undefined', name='agent_string_col', doc='Name of the column that contains the agent string.')¶
agg_col = Param(parent='undefined', name='agg_col', doc='Name of the column to perform aggregation on.')¶

_transformers.cnextractor module¶

class _transformers.cnextractor.CnExtractor[source]¶

Bases: _transformers.sparknativetransformer.SparkNativeTransformer, pyspark.ml.param.shared.HasInputCol, pyspark.ml.param.shared.HasOutputCol

Creates an Output Column (Default=”CN”) using the Input Column (Default=”SM_USERNAME) by: - Removing all characters before “cn=” - Removing the characters after the first comma (including the comma)

Notes: - Assumes the “cn=” and its contents are not at the end of the SM_USERNAME - Reminder that dict must change if SM_USERNAME is no longer used

Input: A Spark dataframe the following column:

Column_Name Datatype Description
self.getOr Default(” inputCol”) string The username for the user currently logged in with this session. SM_USERNAME in raw_logs for reference.

Please refer to README.md for further description of raw_logs.

Output: A Spark Dataframe with the following features calculated:

Column_Name Datatype Description
self.getOr Default(” outputCol”) string Column containing the CommonNames for each user. It is an alpha- numeric string and it may contain NULL values.
sch_dict = {'SM_USERNAME': ['SM_USERNAME', StringType]}¶
set_params()[source]¶

Sets params for the CN extractor

_transformers.ipfeaturegenerator module¶

class _transformers.ipfeaturegenerator.IPFeatureGenerator[source]¶

Bases: _transformers.sparknativetransformer.SparkNativeTransformer, pyspark.ml.param.shared.HasInputCol

A module to generate features related to IP features.

Input: A Spark dataframe containing SM_RESOURCE, SM_EVENTID, SM_ACTION, SM_CLIENTIP, SM_TIMESTAMP, SM_SESSIONID, and SM_USERNAME from raw_logs and the following column (default name: “CN”)

Column_Name Datatype Description
self.getOr Default( “inputCol”) string Column containing the CommonNames for each user. It is an alpha- numeric string and it may contain NULL values. CNs can be generated from SM_USERNAME column through the CnExtractor transformer.

Please refer to README.md for further description.

Output: A Spark Dataframe with the following features calculated on rows

aggregated by time window and SM_CLIENTIP, where the window is calculated using:

  • length: how many seconds the window is
  • step: the length of time between the start of successive
    time window
Column_Name Datatype Description
IP_APP
array

<string>

 A distinct list of main apps from each record in SM_RESOURCE during time window.
IP_AVG_TIME_ BT_RECORDS double Average time between records during the time window.
IP_MAX_TIME_ BT_RECORDS double Maximum time between records during the time window.
IP_MIN_TIME_ BT_RECORDS double Minimum time between records during the time window.
IP_COUNT_ ADMIN_LOGIN integer Count of Admin Login events during the time window, defined by sm_eventid == 7.

IP_COUNT_ UNIQUE_PORTA L_RAC integer A count of Entries containing “rep” followed by a string ending in “/” in SM_RESOURCE during the time window.
IP_COUNT_ RECORDS integer Counts number of CRA_SEQs (dataset primary key)
IP_COUNT_ VISIT integer Count of Visit events during the time window, defined by sm_eventid == 13.

_transformers.resourcesflattener module¶

Bases: _transformers.sparknativetransformer.SparkNativeTransformer

A module for flattening the resources into a list with respect to the input pivot column.

Input: A Spark Dataframe containing SM_RESOURCE and SM_TIMESTAMP (from raw_logs) and the following column (default: “SM_USERNAME”):

Column_Name Datatype Description
self.getOr Default(” agg_col”) string Pivot Column for creating the time window of usage of different resources with respect to the passed column.

Please refer to README.md for description.

Output: A Spark Dataframe with the following features calculated on rows

aggregated by time window and agg_col, where the window is calculated using:

  • length: how many seconds the window is
  • step: the length of time between the start of
    successive time window
Column_Name Datatype Description
SM_RESOURCE
array

<string>

 A list of resources used by the pivot entity within the time window.

_transformers.serverfeaturegenerator module¶

class _transformers.serverfeaturegenerator.ServerFeatureGenerator(window_length=900, window_step=900, interval_threshold=2, interval_epsilon=0.2, agg_col='SM_USERNAME')[source]¶

Bases: _transformers.sparknativetransformer.SparkNativeTransformer

A module to generate features related to server. The ServerFeatureGenerator will aggregate simply on time window and encompass details about login attempts in different time window along with users’ behaviours.

Input: A Spark dataframe. Columns from raw_logs: SM_EVENTID, SM_CLIENTIP, SM_TIMESTAMP, SM_AGENTNAME, SM_RESOURCE. Please refer to README.md for description. List of other required columns:

Column_Name Datatype Description
self.getOr Default(“pa rtioning_e ntity string the column to be targeted for aggregation for generating the immediate preious timestamp. It (by default set to “SM_USERNAME”)

Output features:

Column_Name Datatype Description
StartTime timestamp The beginning of a time window
EndTime timestamp The end of a time window
VolOfAllLogi nAttempts integer Number of all login attempts in the specified time window.
VolOfAllFail edLogins integer
Number of all failed login

attempts in the time window.
MaxOfFailed LoginsWithSa meIPs integer Maximum Number of all failed login attempts with same IPs.
NumOfIPsLogi nMultiAccoun ts integer Number of IPs used for logging into multiple accounts.
NumOfReqsTo ChangePasswo rds integer Number of requests to change passwords in the time window.
NumOfUsersWi thEqualInter valBtnReqs integer Number of users with at least “interval_threshold” intervals between consecutive requests that are equal up to precision “interval_epsilon”.
agg_col = Param(parent='undefined', name='agg_col', doc='Name of the partition column to pivot off of.')¶
interval_epsilon = Param(parent='undefined', name='interval_epsilon', doc='A float used to define feature NumOfUsersWithEqualIntervalBtnReqs')¶
interval_threshold = Param(parent='undefined', name='interval_threshold', doc='An integer used to define feature NumOfUsersWithEqualIntervalBtnReqs')¶

_transformers.smresourcecleaner module¶

class _transformers.smresourcecleaner.SMResourceCleaner[source]¶

Bases: _transformers.sparknativetransformer.SparkNativeTransformer, pyspark.ml.param.shared.HasInputCol, pyspark.ml.param.shared.HasOutputCol

Consolidates SM_RESOURCE elements to simplify redundant data, based off of the following criteria: 1) SAML Requests

Suggested Categorization: Strings containing the prefix ‘/cmsws’ and substrings ‘redirect’ and ‘SAML’. The URLs starting with ‘/SAMLRequest’. Action: Replace with the string ‘<SAML request>’
  1. Query strings
Suggested Categorization: Strings containing the character ‘?’ after the last occurrence of ‘/’. Action: Replace everything after the relevant ‘?’ by ‘*’.
  1. URLs ending with ‘%’
Strip off the trailing ‘%’

4) URLs which start with ‘SMASSERTIONREF’ are quite long and contain the substring ‘/cmsws/public/saml2sso’.

To cleanup these long URLs, replace the entire string with ‘/cmsws/public/saml2sso’.
  1. Other strings
Suggested Categorization: Take whatever’s left over from the previous two categories that isn’t null. Action: Do nothing.

Input: A Spark dataframe containing the following column:

Column_Name Datatype Description
self.getOr Default(” inputCol”) string This is the resource, for example a web page, that the user is requesting. SM_RESOURCE in raw_logs for reference.

Output: A Spark Dataframe with the following features calculated:

Column_Name Datatype Description
self.getOr Default(” outputCol”) string Column containing the cleaned forms of different URLs with respect to the aforementioned cleaning strategies.
sch_dict = {'SM_RESOURCE': ['SM_RESOURCE', StringType]}¶
set_params()[source]¶

Sets params for the SM_RESOURCE Cleaner

_transformers.sparknativetransformer module¶

class _transformers.sparknativetransformer.SparkNativeTransformer[source]¶

Bases: pyspark.ml.base.Transformer

This class inherits from the Transformer class and overrides Transform to add input schema checking. For correct operation it is imperative that _transform be implemented in the child class and a dictionary “sch_dict” be implemented as a class attribute in the child class. The sch_dict is to be formatted as follows: sch_dict = { “Column_1”: [“Column_1”, __Type()], “Column_2”: [“Column_2”, __Type()], }

where:
“Column_X” is the actual Name of the Column __Type() are pyspark.sql.types.
Example:
sch_dict = {“SM_RESOURCE”: [“SM_RESOURCE”, StringType()]}
test_schema(incoming_schema, sch_dict)[source]¶
transform(dataset, params=None)[source]¶

Transforms the input dataset with optional parameters.

New in version 1.3.0.

dataset : pyspark.sql.DataFrame
input dataset
params : dict, optional
an optional param map that overrides embedded params.
pyspark.sql.DataFrame
transformed dataset

A module to generate features related to users.

Input: A Spark dataframe containing CRA_SEQ, SM_ACTION, SM_RESOURCE, SM_CATEGORYID,SM_EVENTID, SM_TIMESTAMP, SM_USERNAME, SM_CLIENTIP, SM_SESSIONID, SM_AGENTNAME and SM_TRANSACTION from raw_logs. and the following columns:

Column_Name Datatype Description
self.getOr Default( “inputCol”) string Column containing the CommonNames for each user. It is an alpha- numeric string and it may contain NULL values. CNs can be generated from SM_USERNAME column through the CnExtractor transformer.

Please refer to README.md for description.

Output: A Spark Dataframe with the following features calculated on rows

aggregated by time window and CN, where the window is calculated using:

  • length: how many seconds the window is
  • step: the length of time between the start of successive
    time window
Column_Name Datatype Description

<string>

UNIQUE_ USERNAME
array

<string>

 A distinct list of CNs in CN during time window.

USER_TIMESTA MP timestamp Earliest timestamp during time window.
AVG_TIME_ BT_RECORDS double Average time between records during the time window.
MAX_TIME_ BT_RECORDS double Maximum time between records during the time window.
MIN_TIME_ BT_RECORDS double Minimum time between records during the time window.
UserLogin Attempts integer Total number of login attempts from the user within the window.
UserAvgFaile dLoginsWithS ameIPs integer Average number of failed logins with same IPs from the user.
UserNumOfAcc ountsLoginWi thSameIPs integer Total number of accounts visited by the IPs used by this user
UserNumOfPas swordChange integer Total number of requests for changing passwords by the user.
UserIsUsing UnusualBrows er integer Whether or not the browser used by user in current time window is same as that in the previous time window
